(417/585) Installing networkmanager (1.42.6-r0)
Executing networkmanager-1.42.6-r0.pre-install
Executing networkmanager-1.42.6-r0.post-install
*
* To modify system network connections without the root password, add your user
* account to the 'plugdev' group.
*
* If you use wifi, bluetooth, ppp, wwan (mobile broadband), adsl or ovs (Open
* vSwitch), install the corresponding plugin: apk add networkmanager-<name>.
*
* If you use NetworkManager features which require dnsmasq, you need to install
* dnsmasq support: apk add networkmanager-dnsmasq
*

(426/585) Installing networkmanager-wifi (1.42.6-r0)
Executing networkmanager-wifi-1.42.6-r0.post-install
*
* To control WiFi devices, install either 'wpa_supplicant' or 'iwd' package,
* enable and start the corresponding service (rc-update add <name>;
* rc-service <name> start), and restart networkmanager.
*
* If you chose iwd, you have to also add 'wifi.backend=iwd' into section
* '[device]' in /etc/NetworkManager/NetworkManager.conf.
*

(420/588) Installing networkmanager (1.42.6-r0)
Executing networkmanager-1.42.6-r0.pre-install
Executing networkmanager-1.42.6-r0.post-install
*
* To modify system network connections without the root password, add your user
* account to the 'plugdev' group.
*
* If you use wifi, bluetooth, ppp, wwan (mobile broadband), adsl or ovs (Open
* vSwitch), install the corresponding plugin: apk add networkmanager-<name>.
*
* If you use NetworkManager features which require dnsmasq, you need to install
* dnsmasq support: apk add networkmanager-dnsmasq
*

(429/588) Installing networkmanager-wifi (1.42.6-r0)
Executing networkmanager-wifi-1.42.6-r0.post-install
*
* To control WiFi devices, install either 'wpa_supplicant' or 'iwd' package,
* enable and start the corresponding service (rc-update add <name>;
* rc-service <name> start), and restart networkmanager.
*
* If you chose iwd, you have to also add 'wifi.backend=iwd' into section
* '[device]' in /etc/NetworkManager/NetworkManager.conf.
*

(420/588) Installing networkmanager (1.42.6-r0)
Executing networkmanager-1.42.6-r0.pre-install
Executing networkmanager-1.42.6-r0.post-install
*
* To modify system network connections without the root password, add your user
* account to the 'plugdev' group.
*
* If you use wifi, bluetooth, ppp, wwan (mobile broadband), adsl or ovs (Open
* vSwitch), install the corresponding plugin: apk add networkmanager-<name>.
*
* If you use NetworkManager features which require dnsmasq, you need to install
* dnsmasq support: apk add networkmanager-dnsmasq
*
(421/588) Installing postmarketos-config-nftables-networkmanager (0.14-r1)
(422/588) Installing networkmanager-lang (1.42.6-r0)
(423/588) Installing networkmanager-cli (1.42.6-r0)
(424/588) Installing pcre (8.45-r3)
(425/588) Installing slang (2.3.3-r1)
(426/588) Installing newt (0.52.23-r1)
(427/588) Installing newt-lang (0.52.23-r1)
(428/588) Installing networkmanager-tui (1.42.6-r0)
(429/588) Installing networkmanager-wifi (1.42.6-r0)
Executing networkmanager-wifi-1.42.6-r0.post-install
*
* To control WiFi devices, install either 'wpa_supplicant' or 'iwd' package,
* enable and start the corresponding service (rc-update add <name>;
* rc-service <name> start), and restart networkmanager.
*
* If you chose iwd, you have to also add 'wifi.backend=iwd' into section
* '[device]' in /etc/NetworkManager/NetworkManager.conf.
*

(420/588) Installing networkmanager (1.42.6-r0)
Executing networkmanager-1.42.6-r0.pre-install
Executing networkmanager-1.42.6-r0.post-install
*
* To modify system network connections without the root password, add your user
* account to the 'plugdev' group.
*
* If you use wifi, bluetooth, ppp, wwan (mobile broadband), adsl or ovs (Open
* vSwitch), install the corresponding plugin: apk add networkmanager-<name>.
*
* If you use NetworkManager features which require dnsmasq, you need to install
* dnsmasq support: apk add networkmanager-dnsmasq
*
(421/588) Installing postmarketos-config-nftables-networkmanager (0.14-r1)

(429/588) Installing networkmanager-wifi (1.42.6-r0)
Executing networkmanager-wifi-1.42.6-r0.post-install
*
* To control WiFi devices, install either 'wpa_supplicant' or 'iwd' package,
* enable and start the corresponding service (rc-update add <name>;
* rc-service <name> start), and restart networkmanager.
*
* If you chose iwd, you have to also add 'wifi.backend=iwd' into section
* '[device]' in /etc/NetworkManager/NetworkManager.conf.
*

Executing networkmanager-1.42.6-r0.post-install
*
* To modify system network connections without the root password, add your user
* account to the 'plugdev' group.
*
* If you use wifi, bluetooth, ppp, wwan (mobile broadband), adsl or ovs (Open
* vSwitch), install the corresponding plugin: apk add networkmanager-<name>.
*
* If you use NetworkManager features which require dnsmasq, you need to install
* dnsmasq support: apk add networkmanager-dnsmasq
*

(176/183) Installing networkmanager-wifi (1.42.6-r0)
Executing networkmanager-wifi-1.42.6-r0.post-install
*
* To control WiFi devices, install either 'wpa_supplicant' or 'iwd' package,
* enable and start the corresponding service (rc-update add <name>;
* rc-service <name> start), and restart networkmanager.
*
* If you chose iwd, you have to also add 'wifi.backend=iwd' into section
* '[device]' in /etc/NetworkManager/NetworkManager.conf.
*

Executing networkmanager-1.42.6-r0.post-install
*
* To modify system network connections without the root password, add your user
* account to the 'plugdev' group.
*
* If you use wifi, bluetooth, ppp, wwan (mobile broadband), adsl or ovs (Open
* vSwitch), install the corresponding plugin: apk add networkmanager-<name>.
*
* If you use NetworkManager features which require dnsmasq, you need to install
* dnsmasq support: apk add networkmanager-dnsmasq
*

(176/183) Installing networkmanager-wifi (1.42.6-r0)
Executing networkmanager-wifi-1.42.6-r0.post-install
*
* To control WiFi devices, install either 'wpa_supplicant' or 'iwd' package,
* enable and start the corresponding service (rc-update add <name>;
* rc-service <name> start), and restart networkmanager.
*
* If you chose iwd, you have to also add 'wifi.backend=iwd' into section
* '[device]' in /etc/NetworkManager/NetworkManager.conf.
*
